result.execSummary:
The defendant Tony Gordon Hetchler was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Tony Gordon Hetchler is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Tony Gordon Hetchler was found guilty of 2nd-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "G" Felony], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(2).
  • Tony Gordon Hetchler was found guilty of Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "I" Felony], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Court dismisses Counts 1, 3, 4, 6, 7, 8, 9 and 10.
Defendant to report by end of business day January 14, 2016 for DNA testing.

 
In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

Apprs: CO: CAR for SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson. ADA:  Michael Edward Nieskes DF ATTY: Barry Curtis Lundeen DF:  Tony Gordon Hetchler appeared. Case called at   Includes 15CF152, 15TR1409, 15TR1410, 15TR1411.   Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads NC to Ct 2 and 5  in 15CF152. DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 2 and 5 in 15CF152. On motion of the State, Crt dismisses Ct 1,3,4,6,7, 8,9,10 in the amended complaint in 15CF152 and 15TR1409, 15TR1410 and 15TR1411. Sentencing arguments. Atty's waive a PSI recommendation. Crt orders: Sentence W/H 
On Ct 2.
2 years probation
- 60 days in St. Croix County Jail condition time with 30 days STAYED. 
   Huber granted 
  to be served within 60 days.
- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
- Costs 
 - Submit DNA sample and pay surcharge.

On Ct. 5
2 years probation concurrent to Ct. 2
- 60 days in St. Croix County Jail condition time with 30 days STAYED concurrent to Ct. 2.
  Huber granted
  to be served within 60 days.
- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
- Costs 
- Submit DNA sample and pay surcharge.

Apply bond on file. 
DE to report by the end of business tomorrow for DNA testing.

TO ALSO INCLUDE 15CF152, 13CM347,13CM256, 15TR1409,15TR1410,15TR1411:
CO: Judge Erickson for Judge Needham; REP: Erin Drost; Clerk: Liddle. ADA:   Jennifer Anne Bork   DF ATTY:  Barry Curtis Lundeen   DF:  Tony Gordon Hetchler appeared from jail. Case called at 10:12 a.m. ADA Bork makes statement. Information has been previously filed by the State. Atty Lundeen now has copy of the information . Waive reading, Waive speedy trial, and pleads NG to  all counts. Atty Lundeen asks for bond modificaiton to $1,000 cash. ADA Bork states that there is sentencing today at this time on 13CM256 and 13CM347. Court will leave motion pending at this time for bond modification. All parties are o.k. with Judge Erickson hearing this matter today. Court calls 13CM256. Probation has been revoked on Ct 2. Atty Lundeen gives argument. State has filed a motion to revoke DPA for Count 1 Battery. Court grants the Motion of the State. Court goes ahead and orders the conviction accepts the plea on 13CM256 Count 1 Battery. ADA Bork gives recommendations and gives argument. Probation Agent Tricia Gilby present. Atty Lundeen gives argument and recommendations. Court orders: 13CM256:
- Ct.1 Battery 90 days jail, run concurrent, eligible for Huber. 33 days credit and credit for good time. Jail to commence no later than noon on May 12, 2015
- Ct.2 Disorderly Conduct 90 days jail, run concurrent

13CM347-Bail Jumping
- 90 days jail to run concurrent to 13CM256. Huber provisions apply, credit for good time and 33 days credit. Jail to commence no later than noon on May 12, 2015.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 21, 2015 at 09:15 am.
filed by ADA Jennifer Bork. eif

1 - 3 PL. eif

Arraignment on May 6, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson. ADA: J. Bork with student intern Schuyler Boggio.  DF ATTY: Joel David Schlitz for Atty. Barry Lundeen. DF: Tony Gordon Hetchler appeared from jail. DF:  Tony Gordon Hetchler appeared from jail. Case called at  Includes 15CF152 (Prelim), (STC) on 15TR1409, 15TR1410, 15TR1411. S/T Deputy Coleman St. Croix County Sheriffs Office. Direct by student intern S. Boggio. Atty. Schlitz asks  the witness be sequestered. Court orders witnesses sequestered. Deputy Coleman identifies the DE in court. Cross by Atty. Schlitz. Court questions Dep. Coleman. S/T Deputy Nicholas Krueger St. Croix County Sheriff's Offfice. Direct by student intern S. Boggio. Deputy Krueger identifies the DE in court. Ex. #1 written statements offered not rec'd. Ex. #2 written statements of Ms. Miller O/R. Court questions Deputy Krueger. Ex#3 certified driving record of the DE O/R. Cross by Atty. Schlitz. Redirect by student intern S. Boggio. Recross by Atty. Schlitz. Court questions priors, there is believed to be seven priors. On 15CF152 Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the DF probably committed that felony and binds over for trial. State has filed the Information. Bond continues in form and amount.  Arraignment scheduled for May 6, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on May 1, 2015 at 08:30 am.
